recipe.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Frittata
recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 8 - fresh spinach: 3 cups - fresh mushrooms (sliced): 1 cup - onion (finely chopped): 1 small - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - garlic (minced): 1 clove - low-fat feta cheese (crumbled): 1/2 cup - salt: 1/4 teaspoon (optional) - black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 2. Sauté Vegetables: Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Sauté onions and garlic until translucent. Add mushrooms and cook until they’re soft. Toss in spinach and cook until wilted. 3. Prepare Egg Mixture: In a large bowl, whisk the egg whites, salt (optional), and black pepper. 4. Combine and Bake: Spread the sautéed vegetables evenly in a baking dish. Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and sprinkle with crumbled feta. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the eggs are set. 5. Serve: Allow it to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 10g, Dietary Fiber: 2g, Sodium: 410mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 6g, Protein: 20g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 425 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Egg Whites: 136 calories for 8 egg whites Spinach: 20 calories for 3 cups Mushrooms: 15 calories for 1 cup Onion: 40 calories for 1 small Olive Oil: 119 calories for 1 tablespoon Garlic: 4 calories per clove Feta Cheese: 91 calories for 1/2 cup - Serving People: 4
